content.description:
This sit start adds several tenuous moves that make this route pretty cool.

Sit start with your left hand in a bad pocket just above the lip and your right hand on a slopey crimp low on the right side of the arete. Get a left heelhook, and work some magic to get established into the stand start position. The way I do it involves a cruxy highstep to the lip after a few moves.
content.location:
This is the sit start of the

Texture Arete

.

content.description: Stand start just left of the arete. Find a right hand on the arete and a right foot just above the lip. Make one or two moves up to a good hold high on the arete. Finish with an easy topout.
content.location:
It is on the parking lot side of the left boulder...arete on the far right side.

This is obviously an established line,...but I'm not sure what the proper name is. The name is not in Horan's guidebook, but I'm happy to change it if anyone has the beta.

content.description: Stand start with two bad pockets just above head high. Place your right foot high on a pebble just above the lip. Lever up on your foot, and reach for a left hand gaston. Figure out the thin face, aiming for the big pocket way up high.
content.location: In the middle of the front side face (parking lot side), start below the big pocket up high.

content.description:
Sit start just left of

Reptilia

at the far right side of the obvious jug rail. Ride it out to the left eventually getting to pockets and then a small crimp just left of the seam. Decipher the short crux, and top out on good holds. Again, the crux is short, but you arrive to it with a little pump. This is a good warm-up.
content.location: This climbs an obvious, leftward jug rail on the frontside and tops out through the seam.

pathTokens: Denver Metropolitan Area Bouldering and Buildering
